TypeSignature.Value: public class AutoCompleteTextView : Android.Widget.EditText, Android.Widget.Filter.IFilterListener, IDisposable

.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit AutoCompleteTextView extends Android.Widget.EditText implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Android.Widget.Filter/IFilterListener, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: An editable text view that shows completion suggestions automatically while the user is typing.

remarks.para: An editable text view that shows completion suggestions automatically while the user is typing. The list of suggestions is displayed in a drop down menu from which the user can choose an item to replace the content of the edit box with.
The drop down can be dismissed at any time by pressing the back key or, if no item is selected in the drop down, by pressing the enter/dpad center key.
The list of suggestions is obtained from a data adapter and appears only after a given number of characters defined by .
The following code snippet shows how to create a text view which suggests various countries names while the user is typing:
See the Text Fields guide.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int DropDownAnchor { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Returns the id for the view that the auto-complete drop down list is anchored to.

remarks.para: Returns the id for the view that the auto-complete drop down list is anchored to.

Sets the view to which the auto-complete drop down list should anchor. The view corresponding to this id will not be loaded until the next time it is needed to avoid loading a view which is not yet instantiated.

Docs.summary: Returns the current height for the auto-complete drop down list.

remarks.para: Returns the current height for the auto-complete drop down list. This can be a fixed height, or to fill the screen, or to fit the height of the drop down's content.
Sets the current height for the auto-complete drop down list. This can be a fixed height, or to fill the screen, or to fit the height of the drop down's content.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void PerformCompletion() cil managed

Docs.summary: Performs the text completion by converting the selected item from the drop down list into a string, replacing the text box's content with this string and finally dismissing the drop down menu.

remarks.para: Performs the text completion by converting the selected item from the drop down list into a string, replacing the text box's content with this string and finally dismissing the drop down menu.

.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void PerformFiltering(class Java.Lang.ICharSequence text, int32 keyCode) cil managed

Docs.param: the last character inserted in the edit box; beware that this will be null when text is being added through a soft input method.
Docs.summary: Starts filtering the content of the drop down list.

remarks.para: Starts filtering the content of the drop down list. The filtering pattern is the content of the edit box. Subclasses should override this method to filter with a different pattern, for instance a substring of text.

MemberSignature.Value: protected void PerformFiltering (string text, int keyCode);

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int Threshold { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Returns the number of characters the user must type before the drop down list is shown.

remarks.para: Returns the number of characters the user must type before the drop down list is shown.
Specifies the minimum number of characters the user has to type in the edit box before the drop down list is shown.
When threshold is less than or equals 0, a threshold of 1 is applied.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
